column4: is powernowd (cpu freq manager) required to sleep a computer ?
nope, sleep is an acpi thing, iirc
system -> prefs -> power managements -> on ac power (desktop pc) -> put computer/display to sleep -> never
does that work, or should i also disable acpid ?
you can really stop sleep by appending noacpi to your kernel boot line in grub ;)
its not sleeping, i dont think ... just freezing
weird, and you don't know what's causing it? any log messages?
maybe it might be wise to append the noacpi thing anyways :)
unfortunately, random freezes are difficult to diagnose
how does powernowd work (if it kicks in ~2-3 hr after no use, it could be the cause)
does powernowd kick in immediately, or does it take time ?
is acpi suspend different than kernel-suspend ?
how do I disable kernel suspend ?
